name: Holiday Inn Express Baltimore - BWI Airport West

reviews.text: Staff was very nice and helpful until the car break-in and than nothing. Pool is on the wrong side of the building so sun goes behind building around 2:00PM. Dumb planning for a pool placement. Shuttle was nice took us and picked us up from a big bash at a local bar and service to the airport was nice. Free hot breakfast is always a good thing. Wouldn't stay again because of car break-in and they said we were not the first break-in. Too bad staff was nice and they are remodeling.
reviews.title: Our car was broken into. They stole the radar detector and misc odd stuff.

reviews.text: Stayed here for business and loved it. Even though it was close to the airport, you did not hear the planes. I took the Amtrak and their shuttle picked me up and returned me to the Amtrak station. Most of the hotels at BWI only pick up at the airport, so you would have to take the shuttle to the airport and then catch the hotel van. Very accommodating.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I only needed a room for one night near the airport and so chose this. It was a good call. The room is very spacious with plenty of amenities including microwave, fridge and Wifi with a decent speed.
reviews.title: Would Come Here Again

reviews.text: The friendly staff directed me to a better place within walking distance to eat than the Dennys (I was tired and disinclined to drive) when I mentioned I was going there.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I've not yet had breakfast here (I'm still at the hotel) but I'm not fussy about that anyhow. I definitely have a good impression of this hotel and if my travel needs bring me back to the Baltimore area, I would definitely book here again. This was my first experience with a Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE Customer Service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: A friend came in from Ohio and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express near BWI. A decent enough hotel, pretty much what you'd expect from a holiday inn express, had a good nights sleep before we were both off to Vegas. A large king bed, a desk with a chair, microwave, small frig, I wouldn't mind staying here again, but there are much nicer hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Stayed here with a friend from out of town

reviews.text: For an airport motel, I suppose it's as good as it gets. Just not much you can walk to, the mall is about 1 mile, same for Wal Mart, which has a redbox video kiosk. 24 Hr Denny's is Right in parking lot, shares/competes for parking. Room normal, safe, clean, etc. Breakfast ok, not exceptional. No coffee/drinks avail. After it closes. Shuttle free, every 30 min, but MUST request it, or CALL from airport to ride. They also take guests to non-airport places on request.
reviews.title: Good for 1 night

reviews.text: My family and I purchased the park and fly package prior to our vacation. I have absolutely no complaints. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. They even gave us a "to go" bag of breakfast goodies, as we had an early flight and missed the breakfast buffet. The shuttle driver was very prompt. I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Park and Fly
Satisfactory for a somewhat older hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for one week, getting the extended stay rate, which ended up being about $80/night. For that price, this hotel was a very good deal. It included a free hot breakfast, which wasn't high quality, but was more than adequate. The hotel has a small pool, which I didn't use, and a small fitness center that includes a couple of tread mills and elliptical machines, as well as a universal weight system. It is located about a mile away from the Arundel Mills Mall, where plenty of shopping and dining is available. Tandem to the Holiday Inn is a Denny's Restaurant, which I did not dare try, since I don't like the food Denny's carries. The room was adequate and included free WiFi, cable TV, a mini-fridge, and a small microwave. However, the room had a musty, smokey smell to it. That musty scent was present throughout the hotel. The hotel furnishings, wall paper, etc all seemed a bit old and definitely looked used. The hotel was more than adequate for me, and as I mentioned, was well worth the price for the weekly rate of ~$80/night. However, when I asked about the rate for staying 2 nights in July, they quoted me around $140/night, which is approximately the price of a room at the somewhat newly constructed Residence Inn or Springfield Inn in Hanover. I opted to stay elsewhere in July since I wasn't willing to pay $140/night for an older Holiday Inn.

Required a hotel close to the airport without time to investigate choices; they had rooms when we called so we booked three rooms for our business travel. Reception was polite, but after getting our room keys after midnight, the desk clerk informed us that there was no hot water but maintenance was working on it. At 5am when we woke to have a shower before 5:30am breakfast, sure enough no hot water - a very cold shower. In addition, the room air conditioner would cycle on and off with a loud thud, and you cannot adjust the airflow away from blowing on the bed...a cold wind all night long. After a sleepless night and a cold shower, we proceeded to breakfast which was to open at 5:30am. But, in keeping with poor customer service, it opened about 10 minutes late. When complaining to the front desk they credited my room charge $20 off the $149 bill for one night.
reviews.title: No hot water, loud A/C, late breakfast
Poor Customer Service
reviews.text: The customer service at this Holiday Inn is extremely lacking. Even after making multiple complaints, no resolution was pursued.

reviews.title: STAY AWAY: Poor customer service
reviews.text: Internet is EXTREMELY slow and disconnects every 5-10 minutes

reviews.title: One of the better HIX properties
reviews.text: I booked at the wrong hotel. I meant to stay at a Holiday Inn Express 30 miles away. I purchased the rooms almost 3 weeks in advance. I called within 10 minutes of my incorrect booking. They would not cancel and said that they would charge me $960 whether I stayed or not.

reviews.title: Amazing!!!
reviews.text: Do not stay with them, there are many hotels near by, go there. I am sure the other hotels have better customer service.

reviews.title: Great hotel--nicely renovated
reviews.text: I wrote the BBB and they agreed that this was a valid complaint. They tried to help me. The hotel sent a fax to them highlighting how they were "Legally" in the right. I applaud you hotel manager, you stand corrected. (BBB Complaint Case#36061​861)

Pros: convenient location very near BWI rental car facility (and opposite direction of most traffic!), clean, comfortable bed, good shower, fast/easy connect internet, friendly front desk staff, and restaurants in walking distance.
reviews.title: Great location if renting car at BWI

reviews.text: Cons: about the only thing I can think of is my common pet peeve – no available electric plugs near the bed/night stand. I had to move the night stand and pull the mattress to one side in order to plug in my phone/alarm and laptop.
reviews.title: Nothing but great customer service!

reviews.text: I stayed one night at the HI Express BWI and found none of the horrors I had seen from previous reviews. The van driver took me to a sports bar as I arrived rather late and had not eaten. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed

reviews.text: My only complaints would be the loud A/C ptac unit and dated case goods in the room.
reviews.title: Fantastic service

reviews.text: Otherwise a restful stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

aka: Holiday Inn Express Baltimore - Bwi Airport West Hotel Hanover
description: Holiday Inn Express BWI has heard your comments about the need to upgrade our hotel and are happy to report that we have just completed a 100% total renovation. From walls and cielings to carpet and furniture you will find we have thought of all your comments and needs. We eagerly look forward to your comments as you visit our location and see for yourself what a great product we have to compliment our staff that is eager to make your stay a great one. Hotel offers free shuttle service to BWI Airport & local attractions within 5 miles. Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express BWI Airport Hotel West! Conveniently located just 7 minutes from BWI Airport; and 3 minutes from Arundel Mills Mall featuring over 200 stores, Dave & Buster's and Medieval Times Dinner Theatre. The hotel is an 18 minute drive to the Baltimore Inner Harbor, Baltimore Orioles at Camden Yards, and the home of the Baltimore Ravens at M&T Bank Stadium. Other attractions include the Baltimore National Aquarium, Annapolis Naval Academy and Historic Annapolis, Six Flags, Timonium Fairgrounds and Washington DC points of interest. The hotel is minutes to Northrop Grumman, Daimler Chrysler, Siemens, John Hopkins, Ft. Meade and NSA. Enjoy the comfort and services you have come to expect from Holiday Inn Express, including the complimentary Express Start Breakfast Bar with our signature Cinnamon Rolls and Simply Smart bedding and bath initiative. The hotel offers free local phone calls, high-speed Internet and shuttle 24/7 to BWI Airport, MARC Commuter Train, MTA Light Rail, and Amtrak Station. Tired of paying expensive parking fees at BWI Airport? Our park and fly package is the perfect solution! Make the Smart Choice for a good night's sleep.
